org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.parsing.as

Class IncludeHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.parsing.as.IncludeHandler

  • public class IncludeHandler
extends Object
    Handler for include processing. Each source file has one IncludeHandler.

    IncludeHandler responsibilities:

    • Produce a IFileSpecification from an include statement.
    • Track include chain to prevent cyclic include.
    • Track and store a tree of include relationships.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • IncludeHandler

        public IncludeHandler(IFileSpecificationGetter fileSpecGetter)
        Create an IncludeHandler. The workspace is used to find a file specification from the workspace file specification pool. If the workspace is null, getFileSpecificationForInclude(String, String) will always create a new IFileSpecification result.
        Parameters:
        fileSpecGetter - IFileSpecificationGetter that should be used by the include hander to open included files.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static IncludeHandler create(IFileSpecificationGetter fileSpecGetter,
                    int startAbsoluteOffset)
        Create an IncludeHandler with a given starting absolute offset. This is useful for creating MXML AST nodes, because MXML node construction routine doesn't track absolute offsets. Instead, it uses the OffsetLookup created by MXMLScopeBuilder to recover the absolute offset, and create a "one-time" IncludeHandler in order to get the nodes with the same absolute offsets and the definitions.
        Parameters:
        fileSpecGetter - IFileSpecificationGetter that should be used by the include hander to open included files.
        startAbsoluteOffset - starting absolute offset
        Returns:
        IncludeHandler

      • creatDefaultIncludeHandler

        public static IncludeHandler creatDefaultIncludeHandler()
        Create an IncludeHandler that does not interception of requests to open included files.
        Returns:
        An IncludeHandler that does not interception of requests to open included files.

      • createForASTBuilding

        public static IncludeHandler createForASTBuilding(IFileSpecificationGetter fileSpecGetter,
                                  String sourcePath,
                                  int localOffset,
                                  int absoluteOffset)
        Create an IncludeHandler with a given starting absolute offset. This is useful for building MXML AST nodes, because MXML node construction routine doesn't track absolute offsets. Instead, it uses the OffsetLookup in MXMLScopeBuilder to recover the absolute offset, and mock a "one-time" IncludeHandler in order to get the nodes with the same absolute offsets and the definitions.
        Parameters:
        sourcePath - enter this file
        localOffset - starting local offset
        absoluteOffset - starting absolute offset
        Returns:
        IncludeHandler IncludeHander

      • getFileSpecificationForInclude

        protected IFileSpecification getFileSpecificationForInclude(String includer,
                                                String includeString)
        Given an the canonical path of a file that contains an include directive with the specified string, return an IFileSpecification for the file the include directive references.

        1. If includeString is an absolute path, a IFileSpecification for that location will be returned.
        2. Otherwise, if this object has a reference to IASProject, the included file path will be resolved firstly in the current directory of the including file, then in each of the source folders on the project until the first existing file is found.
        3. If no on-disk file is found for the included file, a IFileSpecification pointing to the intended default location will be returned.
        Parameters:
        includer - The canonical path of a file that contains the include directive.
        includeString - Unquoted string that refers to a file to be included.
        Returns:
        An IFileSpecification for the included file, or null if can't resolve.

      • propagateLastModified

        public void propagateLastModified(IncludeHandler childIncludeHandler)
        propagates the lastModified timestamp from a IncludeHandler from a child node to this one.
        Parameters:
        childIncludeHandler - The include-handler whose timestamp will be used to set the time stap of this include-handler.

      • getLastModified

        Returns:
        The timestamp of the root include file

      • isCyclicInclude

        protected boolean isCyclicInclude(String filename)
        Check if the file is already on the include chain. If true, including it again will cause cyclic include problem.
        Parameters:
        filename - file name
        Returns:
        True if including the file causes cyclic include problem.

      • onNextToken

        protected void onNextToken(ASToken token)
        Set the absolute offset on an ASToken. The absolute offset is the token's "local" start offset translated into the absolute space.

        Advance absolute offset recorded in the handler by one token.

        Parameters:
        token - The token to update.

      • setProjectAndCompilationUnit

        public final void setProjectAndCompilationUnit(IASProject project,
                                ICompilationUnit compilationUnit)
        Set project reference. The project reference is used to resolve included files in other source folders in the project.
        Parameters:
        project - Current project.

      • handleFileNotFound

        public void handleFileNotFound(IFileSpecification fileSpec)
        When a client catches a file not found, they should call us back and let us know. Only important in an incremental compilation workflow (like Flash Buildler). NOt needed for command line compiles any most unit tests.
        Parameters:
        fileSpec - A file specification.
